Collimator sight to help aim the Stuka's 37mm cannons. Works best when set to 400m range due to low speed of the Stuka.

Install by unzipping included UserSkins folder to your War Thunder game root and combine with any existing folder.

Vilkas custom sight

To change the color of sight use your "Crosshair lighting" keybind.

Installation: Unzip/extract the file and paste them inside your WarThunder folder in WarThunder > UserSights.

For any troubles, suggestions or sight requests you can find me in this discord server: RUzarfS4ua

Check up my profile for other custom sights for different vehicles and nations.

M1 Abrams Series custom sight pack

To change the color of sight use your "Crosshair lighting" keybind.

Installation: Unzip/extract the files and paste them inside your WarThunder folder in WarThunder > UserSights.

!WARNING! This pack contains sights for all Abrams series tanks except the XM-1.


For any troubles, suggestions or sight requests you can find me in this discord server: RUzarfS4ua

Check up my profile for other custom sights for different vehicles and nations.

Sight for Wiesel 1A2 with TOW-2/2A.

Features:

  • Missile points of fall for shooting nearby targets (and avoiding smashing the floor);
  • Distance estimation reticles for 3.3m-width targets; (roughly the size of T-54/64/72/etc.)
  • Time-to-hit table for TOW-2/2A based on tests;
  • Clean cross design to help tracking distant missiles.

Please check the 2nd screenshot for further descriptions.

Installation:
Drop the .blk file into [GameFolder]/UserSights/germ_wiesel_1_tow and reload ...

Sights for T-55AM-1 & T-55AMD-1

Features:
1. A missile fall-down reticle for close range combat;
2. A horizontal reticle for shooting 3BM25 while moving (or shooting targets having horizontal speed);
3. A sparse layout for slightly better vision under the awkward 8X optics.

Usage:
- Missile fall-down reticle:
the larger circle (lowest) is the point of fall at 100m, which is also almost accurate for 50m;
the smaller circle (middle) is for 200m;
missiles fall at the bottom of sight center circle(highest) on 300m.
- Hori...

NOT A SIGHT

OLD STYLE KILLFEED

Note:

  • works only if the game is set to english
  • may have some side effects


Basically what is does is remove the name of the bullet, rocket, missle, bomb.... from the killfeed

To install it extract the .zip folder into your war thunder directory and in the config.blk file add testLocalization:b=yes in the debug paragraph.

Sights for ZTZ96A/96AP, ZTZ99/99A and VT-4A1.

Features:
1. A clean design with limited shell corrections (400m, 800m, 2km and 4km kept), maximizing the advantage of high-res thermal scopes;
2. Reticles telling offsets for aiming at targets having horizontal speed.
(See screenshots and "Detailed explanations for speed offset reticles" in my old post for detailed usage: https://live.warthunder.com/post/1092893/en/ )

Update 5-29-25: Added AoA sighting to the A-1H's Zuni rockets.

Rocket sight pack for all AD-4's, A-1H, AD-2, and AM-1 planes. Includes 2 sights for the A-1H for Mighty Mouse and Zuni separately. US AD-4 gets a Might Mouse sight; French AD-4's get a T10 sight; AD-2 and AM-1 get an HVAR sight. Ranging is as-indicated on the collimators. (yes the Zuni really can be fired accurately at 4000m when at or above 550 kmh).

Update 5-29-25: Adjusted for accuracy. Added T80 rocket long range. Added Extreme long range aiming for both rockets. Added AoA sighting.

SNEB and T80 sight for the Strikemaster Mk88 Jet. MG's are sighted in the middle ring. Use the boxes when at 600m distance and 460kmh or more. Use the lower part when IAS is under 420kmh. Use the side aiming parts when at or under 300m. Use the top aiming area when speed is greater than 580kmh. Outer sight tulips are used for 3...

~HISTORICAL T-72AV TURMS-T SIGHT~
For 4k, 1440p and 1080p

The Syrian T-72AVS uses the TURMS-T fire control system from the Italian company Galileo Avionica. TURMS-T is not similar to TURMS-D (Ariete AMV and Centauro II) or the standard TURMS (Ariete and Centauro I) in its gunner's sight. TURMS-T uses the ARES sight, TURMS-D uses the LOTHAR sight and I don't know about the standard TURMS. I have seen a lot of confusion on the internet about this, and it is important not to mix them up.

I have also seen a picture of TURMS-T used on the T-72M4CZ, and that has a slightly diffe...

~HISTORICAL T-72M2 MODERNA SIGHT~
For 4k, 1440p and 1080p

The T-72M2 Moderna uses the Fotona TIGS (Thermal Imaging Gunner's Sight) and a TPD-K1 backup sight. The reference image for this sight is taken from the Fotona STIGS sight, which uses the same display/monitor as the TIGS.

The correct field of view is applied (5.4x9.2°), but the in-game magnification is taken from the TPD-K1 (8x), instead of the Fotona TIGS variable magnification (somewhere around 4x-16x) so the lower text won't be visible by default (since it's supposed to be zoomed out more), you have to look down...

Update 11-9-25: Corrected missing asterisk on J21 gunsight file

Gun and rocket sight for the Swedish A21A-3, A21A-1, and J21A-2. Only M/49B rockets are sighted, although other *might* work.

To aim M/49B rockets Dive shallow at 10-15 degrees and use the main boxes to aim rockets at 600m when IAS is above 450kmh. If IAS is below 360kmh, use the lower aiming section (Only sighted for close range). If IAS is higher than 550kmh, use the section just below the gun reticle. If coming in for a Top att...

Ashley from "Coffin of Andy and Leyley"

How to install:
-Create UserSights folder in your folder with installed WT
-Open folder "all_tanks"
-Copy everything from zip file to that folder
-Restart the game or launch it
-Go to Options -> Main -> Ground vehicle Battle Settings -> Sight settings
-Find "Redicle" on the right
-Switch Default grid sight to one of the custom sights.
-Cry about it

Rocket and gunsight collimator for the A2D-1 SkyShark. The gunsight is good for 600-2000m, and the dotted lines coming from the sides provide accurate single-gun fire at distances below 600m by following the path of the guns.

ROCKET AIMING IS WEIRD FOR THE A2D!!!! The boxes down low are for left and right wing close (300m or less) launches. TILTING A WIN...

Ryo Yamada from "Bocchi the Rock!"

How to install:
-Create UserSights folder in your folder with installed WT
-Open folder "all_tanks"
-Copy everything from zip file to that folder
-Restart the game or launch it
-Go to Options -> Main -> Ground vehicle Battle Settings -> Sight settings
-Find "Redicle" on the right
-Switch Default grid sight to one of the custom sights.
-Done

#bocchi_the_rock #anime

#ztz99_ii #ztz99iii #mbt2000

CN - ZTZ99II / III /MBT2000 Sight

Zoom :
ZTZ99 : 6.0x - 11.0x
MBT2000 : 3.0x - 10.0x

Usage method : Put the. blk file in the folder of the vehicle，Restart the game，Select a custom sight in Game Options - General Combat Settings
Example : E:\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\War Thunder\UserSights\cn_ztz_99

使用说明 : 把.blk文件放到对应载具的文件夹内，重启游戏或重新加载自定义瞄具，在游戏选项-通用战斗设置中选择自定义瞄具。
例 : E:\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\War Thunder\UserSights\cn_ztz_99
